intro: Mesembryanthemum karrooense, commonly known as the Karoo mesem, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves to survive dry conditions. It typically blooms in spring or early summer, producing yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators. Mesembryanthemum karrooense is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
